title: Wales Without a Car
suitableFor: Active solo travellers or small groups comfortable with public transport and moderate physical activity. Those interested in exploring the natural beauty of Wales on a budget.
notSuitableFor: Those with mobility issues, families with young children requiring strollers, or those seeking luxury travel experiences.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Welsh weather is unpredictable. Be prepared for rain even in summer. Coastal areas can be windy.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Parking in Snowdonia can be extremely challenging, especially during peak season. Arrive early or use park-and-ride services. The TrawsCymru bus service is generally reliable, but check timetables in advance.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Book accommodations, especially hostels, well in advance, particularly for weekends and holidays. Some activities like coasteering require pre-booking.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A moderate level of fitness is required for hiking and coasteering. Be prepared for walking and standing for extended periods when using public transport.
